availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Kentucky governor. Stafford County, Virginia, Native. Son of William Garrard and Mary Naughty Garrard. Married to Elizabeth Montjoy Garrard in 1765. Father of Theophilius Toulmin Garrard, John Mountjoy Garrard, Margaret Garrard, Elizabeth Garrard Brooks, Ann Elinor Garrard Hawkins, Daniel Garrard, Maria Garrard Dudley, and James Garrard Junior. Served as colonel in the Revolutionary War. Resident in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1783. Farmer, lumber mill owner, and Baptist preacher in Bourbon County, Kentucky in the 1780s. A Jeffersonian Republican. Governor of Kentucky from 1796 to 1804.

ab.bibl:
Lowell H. Harrison, "Garrard, James" in The Kentucky Encyclopedia, John E. Kleber, ed. (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1992), 363-4.
Find A Grave, "James Garrard (1749-1822)," Memorial #18123008, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/18123008/james-garrard (accessed December 20, 2019).
